Traffic Code: Speed limits: 200km/h on Highways, 150km/h outside the city and 120km/h in city. Special Zones: 60km/h.

CRIME: Absence of Valid License Plate
Minor Speed Violation (10-30 Km/H over speed limit)
Mediocre Speed Violation (31-60 KM/H over speed limit)
Major Speed Violation (61-100KM/H over speed limit)
Notes: Class A Infraction - Revoke Driving license

CRIME: Reckless Speed Violation (101KM/H+ over speed limit)
Notes: ONLY GIVE THIS IF USING RADAR (Not pulled over driver)

CRIME: Reckless Driving
Notes: ONLY GIVE THIS IF PULLING OVER - Revoke Driving License

CRIME: Driving the Opposite Lane
Driving the Opposite Lane on a Highway
Stopping on a non-highway road for No Reason
Stopping on highway for No Reason
Driving on Deserted Sidewalks
Chaotic Movement Between Lanes
Failure to Keep Distance
Hard Braking
Creating Obstruction for Overtaking
Driving Under Influence (DUI)
Participation in a Street Race
Organising a Street Race
Excessive use of a horn
Use of anti-radar equipment
Display or use of emergency lights on a vehicle not owned by the state.
Failure to yield for a red light
Causing an accident due to failing to yield for a red light

Excessive revving of an engine in public where there is not previous
permission granted by an official of the state
Performing "Burn-outs" and other anti social actions in a vehicle
Riding a bicycle or scooter on sidewalk
Riding a bicycle or scooter on the grounds of a state facility or state owned property
Poor lane discipline on a highway
Poor lane discipline not on a highway
Crossing the highway not at designated intersections and turning points.
Driving anywhere except a designated roadway (off-roading).
Jaywalking
Abandonment of vehicle

Dangerous transportation of people. Transporting any person in a
dangerous and unsafe manner, in a position where seatbelts and/or proper
posture for crash safety regulations are not met.
Violation of the speed limit in a special zone (60 km/h).
See Parking Section Below
Unauthorized Vehicle Parking in Prison
Not using headlights whilst in motion at night or in poor visibility conditions
A vehicle operated in an unsafe condition that impairs the vehicle's ability to drive and interferes with the vehicle's normal and regular functioning
Inoperable brake lights
Vehicle being driven with visible smoke coming from it
Missing or smashed windscreen
PARKING VIOLATIONS
Parking along roadways a driver must park a vehicle in the direction of traffic with its wheels parallel and next to the curb or side of the road or two right wheels on the curb.
Illegal parking on red curb
Blocking a Lane of Traffic (More than ½)
Blocking the Exit of Anywhere
Illegal parking at or in a crosswalk
Blocking more than ⅔ of the sidewalk or bike path
Illegal parking on any dividing strip (Double yellow lines or No parking stripes)
Illegal parking facing the opposing flow of traffic
Illegal parking on Bridges or in Tunnels
Illegal parking on a Highway or Freeway
Parking closer than 20 Meters to a building on fire
Illegal parking blocking bus stop
Illegal parking on Railroad tracks or within the skidding of a train wagon
Illegal parking in a parking space marked in yellow
Notes:
IMPORTANT: 
Only FINE or TOW. Do NOT do both.
Radar Fines must have (RADAR) At the end.

CRIME: Illegal parking in violation of road surface markings including parking spaces
Illegal parking on lawns, in green spaces or other places not intended for parking
In violation with the parking direction mentioned in Article 7
Unauthorized presence of vehicles on the territory of the prison

Traffic Code: LICENSEPLATE - TC 9.1 Illegal parking at Capitol (City Hall) ($20,000)

Stars: Green - Parking is allowed for all citizens.
Orange - Parking is allowed for state vehicles or street venders
Red - Parking is prohibited for everyone.
Note: Violation of parking direction (blue) is punishable by article 6.2.q.
